page.title: 12Fruit Farm - Maintenance
page.content: Fruit Farm - Maintainance The season starts with pruning, which takes one person 3 months. By April spraying for pest control (aphids,red spider, mite, Tortrix, etc.) and fungicides for mildew, scab etc. are applied at l0 day intervals until early August. Sprays are becoming safer and more selective in control but pests still become resistant relatively quickly. Calcium and boron are also sprayed on the trees to counteract deficiency in the light Ross sandstone soils. The trees are on rootstock M.M.9 and having shallow roots are susceptible to leaching. The rootstock limits tree size to 6 ft. so no ladderwork is necessary, but the tree needs staking all its life. Other sprays prolong harvesting.
